Requirement: Unarmed or a weapon with the Unarmed trait.

Twisting your off-hand to your front and sliding your dominant foot backward, you pull your fists in front of your face in a defensive stance and stand on your toes.

Pros

Fist Fighter

  • Your unarmed damage die increases two sizes.
1-2 Punch
  • Unarmed attacks have the 'Light' trait.
  • If your unarmed attacks already have the 'Light' trait, their damage die increases by one additional size instead.
Uppercut
  • In place of an attack once per turn, you can attempt to make an uppercut against a creature of equal or smaller size. They must make a Strength or Dexterity (Save) check of DC 8 + your Strength Modifier + your Proficiency Bonus. On failure, the creature takes 1 bludgeoning damage and is knocked 5ft into the air and remains there until the end of your turn, at which point they resume falling and fall @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.RK3DF56CKMQUV6DM]{Prone}. On success, they dodge the attack and they take no damage.
  • For each attack that hits the target while airborne from an Uppercut, such as from a multi-attack, reaction, or desperate action, they take an additional 1d6 bludgeoning damage when landing.
Jab & Weave
  • If you use the Self-Defense action, you can make an off-hand attack as a minor action.

Cons

Misdressed

  • Your armor grants an AC of 10 + your Dexterity Modifier.
Gassing Out
  • Each time you attack, your attacks gain a -1 to hit until the start of your next non-desperate turn. This remains even after exiting this stance.
Punch The Wall
  • Your unarmed attacks only deal 1 bludgeoning damage if your target is wearing Heavy Armor or is a larger creature with natural armor.
